intro: Helianthemum variabile var. mutabile, commonly known as the variable helianthemum, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically green, though they may exhibit some variation in color depending on environmental conditions. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats.
